title: Jenkins child jobs not stopped by interrupt signal
body:
Carry on the discussion from https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/issues/20395#issuecomment-2430033776

@JasonFengJ9  commented:
So [Click here to forcibly terminate running steps](https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/job/Grinder/44305/console#) doesn't abort the child jobs.
Do we have to log in to the machine manually to kill the processes?

timeline_data.body:
Issue Number: 20396
Status: Open
Recommended Components: comp:build, comp:vm, comp:test
Recommended Assignees: adambrousseau, babsingh, jasonfengj9

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

timeline_data.body:
It depends what the child job is doing. It's a known issue with setting ITERATIONS that an interrupt signal only stops the current iteration and the job continues with the next iteration. 

When you interrupt the first time it signals all the child jobs and the parent waits for them to finish. By using [Click here to forcibly terminate running steps](https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/job/Grinder/44305/console#) it may send another interrupt to the child jobs and then it forcibly kills the parent so it's not waiting for them to finish any more.

issue.title: MiniMix_3h_0 FAILED j9mm.107 ASSERTION FAILED at src/openj9/runtime/gc_base/OwnableSynchronizerObjectBuffer.cpp:75: ((false && (object != _head)))

timeline_data.body: Okay, what's the reliable way to ensure all child jobs are aborted, or is there such a link instead of logging in to the machine manually?

The only way I know to kill the child jobs is to keep stopping the parent job until all the child iterations are finished. Or open the child jobs individually and do the same. If each child isn't running the same iteration, continuous stopping may interrupt the cleanup steps at the end of job. 

 It's been a known behavior for some time, not sure if @llxia has any plans to change it.

I think we can try to check `currentBuild.result` inside the loop. If it is `ABORTED`, then break.

@annaibm can you try to add the check inside `for` https://github.com/adoptium/aqa-tests/blob/2c47e24c512b6419c8b2a01b75ae2d10c4dd9215/buildenv/jenkins/JenkinsfileBase#L766-L787?

- In [a simple case](https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/job/Grinder/44425/), child jobs can be stopped without the problem. The issue occurs when running complicated tests (i.e., [MiniMix_3h_0](https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/view/Test_grinder/job/Grinder/44430/)).

- `currentBuild.result` may not contain the correct info. We had to set the build result based on the exception https://github.com/adoptium/aqa-tests/blob/master/buildenv/jenkins/openjdk_tests#L490-L497

comments_data.body:
It depends what the child job is doing. It's a known issue with setting ITERATIONS that an interrupt signal only stops the current iteration and the job continues with the next iteration. 

When you interrupt the first time it signals all the child jobs and the parent waits for them to finish. By using [Click here to forcibly terminate running steps](https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/job/Grinder/44305/console#) it may send another interrupt to the child jobs and then it forcibly kills the parent so it's not waiting for them to finish any more.
Okay, what's the reliable way to ensure all child jobs are aborted, or is there such a link instead of logging in to the machine manually?

The only way I know to kill the child jobs is to keep stopping the parent job until all the child iterations are finished. Or open the child jobs individually and do the same. If each child isn't running the same iteration, continuous stopping may interrupt the cleanup steps at the end of job. 

 It's been a known behavior for some time, not sure if @llxia has any plans to change it.

I think we can try to check `currentBuild.result` inside the loop. If it is `ABORTED`, then break.

@annaibm can you try to add the check inside `for` https://github.com/adoptium/aqa-tests/blob/2c47e24c512b6419c8b2a01b75ae2d10c4dd9215/buildenv/jenkins/JenkinsfileBase#L766-L787?

- In [a simple case](https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/job/Grinder/44425/), child jobs can be stopped without the problem. The issue occurs when running complicated tests (i.e., [MiniMix_3h_0](https://hyc-runtimes-jenkins.swg-devops.com/view/Test_grinder/job/Grinder/44430/)).

- `currentBuild.result` may not contain the correct info. We had to set the build result based on the exception https://github.com/adoptium/aqa-tests/blob/master/buildenv/jenkins/openjdk_tests#L490-L497
